intro: Rhaponticum aulieatense, commonly known as the Aulieatea rhapontic, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a robust, upright stem with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and grayish in appearance. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
